lines.text: You ain't gonna last long, son. There ain't no soft-hearted gunfighters.
I think he's come to kill me, Catherine. Hired by the railroad, I imagine.
Why are you letting him stay?
Because when he's ready, it ain't gonna do no good to hide.
Who will they send to get me? You?
No. Probably just some ordinary man whose morals wouldn't keep him from shooting you in the back.
I killed my husband. He found out and started beating me. He was gonna come after you. I didn't mean to kill him.
A man's life for a moment's weakness. It doesn't seem like a fair exchange.
I bring the west to the east. People say I write lies, but the truth is... it's dead... in a year or less.
What do you want?
To buy a little legend... the touch of pulchritude for the people back east... a piece of the American west they can believe in.
You mean lie to them?
Of course. The lies they need - we all need.
My life is not for sale.
Nonsense! It's only a question of who pays and when.
[first lines]
Pretty sight, no more Japanese.
How 'bout my drink now?
You know what you're gonna be tomorrow, grease ball? A big hunk 'o dead meat, and little headline.
That's better than a big bag of shit every day.
This is Virgil, Jr.
[touching his wife's belly]
How a man knows what's in a woman's stomach, I'll never know.
It's simple, he put it there, that's how.
